member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Collections.DynamicArray`1
member.summary: Object representing a more concrete version of the dynamic array.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Collections.BaseDynamicArray`1
member.summary: An abstract class for representing a dynamic array of objects.
member.remarks:
This was designed as a point of convenience to take some of the annoyance out of inheriting a collection.
This class provides a simplified method of inheriting a basic list collection. It holds no benefit over the System.Collections.Generic.List object, which it uses internally.
This class, like the other classes in the Collections namespace, implements the IEnumerable interface already to return an iterator interface for enumeration.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.IntersectionQueries

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.IntersectionQueries.Query(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Plane,SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection test on a plane and an AABB.
member.returns: Intersection result.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.IntersectionQueries.Query(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Ray,SharpUtilities.Mathematics.SphereVolume,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection test on a ray and a sphere volume.
member.param: TRUE to discard results from inside the sphere, FALSE to include.
member.returns: Intersection result.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.IntersectionQueries.Query(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.SphereVolume,SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection test on a sphere and an AABB.
member.returns: TRUE if an intersection exists, FALSE if not.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.IntersectionQueries.Query(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.SphereVolume,SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Plane)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection test on a sphere and a plane.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.IntersectionQueries.Query(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Ray,SharpUtilities.Mathematics.PlaneList,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection test on a ray and a list of planes.
member.param: TRUE to use inverse normals, FALSE to use regular.
member.returns: Intersection results.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags
member.summary: Enumeration containing flags for a raw input device.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.None
member.summary: No flags.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.Remove
member.summary: If set, this removes the top level collection from the inclusion list. This tells the operating system to stop reading from a device which matches the top level collection.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.Exclude
member.summary: If set, this specifies the top level collections to exclude when reading a complete usage page. This flag only affects a TLC whose usage page is already specified with PageOnly.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.PageOnly
member.summary: If set, this specifies all devices whose top level collection is from the specified usUsagePage. Note that Usage must be zero. To exclude a particular top level collection, use Exclude.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoLegacy
member.summary: If set, this prevents any devices specified by UsagePage or Usage from generating legacy messages. This is only for the mouse and keyboard.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.InputSink
member.summary: If set, this enables the caller to receive the input even when the caller is not in the foreground. Note that WindowHandle must be specified.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.CaptureMouse
member.summary: If set, the mouse button click does not activate the other window.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.NoHotKeys
member.summary: If set, the application-defined keyboard device hotkeys are not handled. However, the system hotkeys; for example, ALT+TAB and CTRL+ALT+DEL, are still handled. By default, all keyboard hotkeys are handled. NoHotKeys can be specified even if NoLegacy is not specified and WindowHandle is NULL.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.RawInputDeviceFlags.AppKeys
member.summary: If set, application keys are handled. NoLegacy must be specified. Keyboard only.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.ScreenWidth
member.summary: Screen width.

member.summary: Screen height.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.VerticalScrollbarArrowWidth
member.summary: Width in pixels of the arrow bitmap on the vertical scrollbar.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.HorizontalScrollbarHeight
member.summary: Height of a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.CaptionHeight
member.summary: Height, in pixels, of a normal caption area.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.BorderWidth
member.summary: Width, in pixels, of a window border. This is equivalent to the SM_CXEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.BorderHeight
member.summary: Height, in pixels, of a window border. This is equivalent to the SM_CXEDGE value for windows with the 3-D look.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DialogFrameThicknessWidth
member.summary: Same as FixedFrameThicknessWidth.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DialogFrameThicknessHeight
member.summary: Same as FixedFrameThicknessHeight.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.VerticalThumbBoxHeight
member.summary: Height of the thumb box in a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.HorizontalThumbBoxWidth
member.summary: Width of the thumb box in a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DefaultIconWidth
member.summary: Default width of an icon, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DefaultIconHeight
member.summary: Default height of an icon, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.CursorWidth
member.summary: Width of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.CursorHeight
member.summary: Height of a cursor, in pixels. The system cannot create cursors of other sizes.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SingleLineMenuHeight
member.summary: Height of a single-line menu bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.FullScreenWidth
member.summary: Width of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.FullScreenHeight
member.summary: Height of the client area for a full-screen window on the primary display monitor, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.KanjiWindowHeight
member.summary: For double byte character set versions of the system, this is the height of the Kanji window at the bottom of the screen, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MousePresent
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse is installed; zero otherwise. This value is rarely zero, because of support for virtual mice and because some systems detect the presence of the port instead of the presence of a mouse.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.VerticalScrollbarWidth
member.summary: Width of a vertical scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.HorizontalScrollbarArrowWidth
member.summary: Width of the arrow bitmap on a horizontal scroll bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DebugUser
member.summary: Nonzero if the debug version of User.exe is installed; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MouseButtonsSwapped
member.summary: Nonzero if the meanings of the left and right mouse buttons are swapped; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MinimumWindowWidth
member.summary: Minimum width of a window, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MinimumWindowHeight
member.summary: Minimum height of a window, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.CaptionButtonWidth
member.summary: Width of a button in a window's caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.CaptionButtonHeight
member.summary: Height of a button in a window's caption or title bar, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.WindowBorderThicknessWidth
member.summary: Thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.WindowBorderThicknessHeight
member.summary: Thickness of the sizing border around the perimeter of a window that can be resized, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MinimumTrackingWidth
member.summary: Minimum tracking width of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MinimumTrackingHeight
member.summary: Minimum tracking height of a window, in pixels. The user cannot drag the window frame to a size smaller than these dimensions.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DoubleClickRegionWidth
member.summary: Width of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DoubleClickRegionHeight
member.summary: Height of the rectangle around the location of a first click in a double-click sequence, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.IconHorizontalSpacing
member.summary: Width of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.IconVerticalSpacing
member.summary: Height of a grid cell for items in large icon view, in pixels

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MenuDropAlignment
member.summary: Nonzero if drop-down menus are right-aligned with the corresponding menu-bar item; zero if the menus are left-aligned.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.PenWindows
member.summary: Nonzero if the Microsoft Windows for Pen computing extensions are installed; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DBCSEnabled
member.summary: Nonzero if User32.dll supports DBCS; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MouseButtonCount
member.summary: Number of buttons on mouse, or zero if no mouse is installed.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.FixedFrameHeight

member.summary: Same as WindowBorderThicknessWidth.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SizingBorderHeight
member.summary: Same as WindowBorderThicknessHeight.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SecurityPresent
member.summary: Nonzero if security is present; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.EdgeWidth
member.summary: Width of a 3-D border, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.EdgeHeight
member.summary: Height of a 3-D border, in pixels.

member.summary: Width of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MinimizedSpacingHeight
member.summary: Height of a grid cell for a minimized window, in pixels.

member.summary: Default width of a small icon.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SmallIconHeight
member.summary: Default height of a small icon.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SmallCaptionHeight
member.summary: Height of a small caption, in pixels.

member.summary: Width of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SmallCaptionButtonsHeight
member.summary: Height of small caption buttons, in pixels.

member.summary: Width of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MenuBarButtonHeight
member.summary: Height of menu bar buttons, such as the child window close button used in the multiple document interface, in pixels.

member.summary: Flags specifying how the system arranged minimized windows.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MinimizedWindowWidth
member.summary: Width of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MinimizedWindowHeight
member.summary: Height of a minimized window, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MaximumTrackingWidth
member.summary: Default maximum width of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MaximumTrackingHeight
member.summary: Default maximum height of a window that has a caption and sizing borders, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MaximizedTopLevelWidth
member.summary: Default width, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MaximizedTopLevelHeight
member.summary: Default height, in pixels, of a maximized top-level window on the primary display monitor.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.NetworkPresent
member.summary: Least significant bit is set if a network is present; otherwise, it is cleared. The other bits are reserved for future use.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.CleanBoot
member.summary: Value that specifies how the system was started: 0 Normal boot 1 Fail-safe boot 2 Fail-safe with network boot Fail-safe boot (also called SafeBoot, Safe Mode, or Clean Boot) bypasses the user's startup files.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DragRectangleWidth
member.summary: Width of a rectangle centered on a drag point to allow for limited movement of the mouse pointer before a drag operation begins, in pixels. It allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.DragRectangleHeight
member.summary: Height of a rectangle centered on a drag point to allow for limited movement of the mouse pointer before a drag operation begins, in pixels. It allows the user to click and release the mouse button easily without unintentionally starting a drag operation.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.ShowSounds
member.summary: Nonzero if the user requires an application to present information visually in situations where it would otherwise present the information only in audible form; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MenuCheckMarkBitmapWidth
member.summary: Width of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MenuCheckMarkBitmapHeight
member.summary: Height of the default menu check-mark bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SlowMachine
member.summary: Nonzero if the computer has a low-end (slow) processor; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MiddleEastEnabled
member.summary: Nonzero if the system is enabled for Hebrew and Arabic languages, zero if not.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MouseWheelPresent
member.summary: Nonzero if a mouse with a wheel is installed; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.VirtualScreenLeft
member.summary: Coordinates for the left side of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.VirtualScreenTop
member.summary: Coordinates for the top side of the virtual screen. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.VirtualScreenWidth
member.summary: Width of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.VirtualScreenHeight
member.summary: Height of the virtual screen, in pixels. The virtual screen is the bounding rectangle of all display monitors.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MonitorCount
member.summary: Number of display monitors on the desktop.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.SameDisplayFormat
member.summary: Nonzero if all the display monitors have the same color format, zero otherwise. Note that two displays can have the same bit depth, but different color formats.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.InputMethodManagedEnabled
member.summary: Nonzero if Input Method Manager/Input Method Editor features are enabled; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.FocusBorderWidth
member.summary: Width of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle drawn by DrawFocusRect. This value is in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.FocusBorderHeight
member.summary: Height of the left and right edges of the focus rectangle drawn by DrawFocusRect. This value is in pixels.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.TabletPC
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP Tablet PC edition, zero if not.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.MediaCenter
member.summary: Nonzero if the current operating system is the Windows XP, Media Center Edition, zero if not.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.RemoteSession
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. If the calling process is associated with a Terminal Services client session, the return value is nonzero. If the calling process is associated with the Terminal Server console session, the return value is zero.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.ShuttingDown
member.summary: Nonzero if the current session is shutting down; zero otherwise.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SystemMetrics.RemoteControl
member.summary: This system metric is used in a Terminal Services environment. Its value is nonzero if the current session is remotely controlled; zero otherwise.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API
member.summary: Static class for Native Win32 methods and corresponding structures.
member.remarks:
This is a grouping of any API calls regularly used by SharpUtilities or its dependant applications.
This list is by no means complete. The Win32 API is just massive and would probably take a lifetime to map.
These calls are considered "unsafe" and thus should be used with care. If you don't know how to use a function, or why you want it, you probably don't need to use them.
Please note that a lot of the enumerators/structures have slightly different names than their Win32 counterparts. This was done for the sake of readability. This does NOT affect their results or their effect on the results of their related functionality.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.MAX_PATH
member.summary: Maximum number of characters that can fit into a path.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.JOYERR_UNPLUGGED
member.summary: Joystick is unplugged.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.JOYERR_NOCANDO
member.summary: Joystick is already captured or timer is unavailable.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.EnumFontFamiliesEx(System.IntPtr,SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.LOGFONT@,SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.FONTENUMPROC,System.IntPtr,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Function to enumerate font families.
member.param: LOGFONT structure that contains information about the fonts to enumerate.
Parameter to pass to the callback.
member.returns: The return value is the last value returned by the callback function. This value depends on which font families are available for the specified device.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.GetKeyState(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: Function to return the state of a specified key.
member.returns: A bitmap containing state information about they key.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.ExtractIconEx(System.String,System.Int32,System.IntPtr[],System.IntPtr[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Function to extract an icon from a file.
member.returns: If the nIconIndex parameter is -1, the phiconLarge parameter is NULL, and the phiconSmall parameter is NULL, then the return value is the number of icons contained in the specified file. Otherwise, the return value is the number of icons successfully extracted from the file.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.SHGetFileInfo(System.String,System.UInt32,SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.SHFILEINFO@,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Function to get file information from the shell.
member.returns: Returns a value whose meaning depends on the uFlags parameter. If uFlags does not contain SHGFI_EXETYPE or SHGFI_SYSICONINDEX, the return value is nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise. If uFlags contains the SHGFI_EXETYPE flag, the return value specifies the type of the executable file

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.DestroyIcon(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Function to destroy an unmanaged icon resource.
member.returns: Non zero if successful, 0 if not.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Native.Win32.Win32API.joySetCapture(System.IntPtr,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Function to capture a joystick.
member.param: Window handle to bind joystick with.
TRUE to send messages only if the position changes outside of the dead zone, FALSE to always send messages.
member.returns: 0 if successful, non-zero if not.

member.summary: Function to release the capture of a joystick.
member.returns: 0 if successful, non-zero if not.

member.summary: Function to set the dead zone of the joystick.
member.returns: 0 if successful, non-zero if not.

member.summary: Function to retrieve the dead zone of the joystick.

member.summary: Function to create a font.
member.param: Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between the escapement vector and the x-axis of the device. The escapement vector is parallel to the base line of a row of text.
Specifies the angle, in tenths of degrees, between each character's base line and the x-axis of the device.
Specifies the weight of the font in the range 0 through 1000. For example, 400 is normal and 700 is bold. If this value is zero, a default weight is used.
Specifies an italic font if set to TRUE.
Specifies an underlined font if set to TRUE.
Specifies a strikeout font if set to TRUE.
Specifies the output precision. The output precision defines how closely the output must match the requested font's height, width, character orientation, escapement, pitch, and font type.
Specifies the clipping precision. The clipping precision defines how to clip characters that are partially outside the clipping region.
Specifies the output quality. The output quality defines how carefully GDI must attempt to match the logical-font attributes to those of an actual physical font.
Specifies the pitch and family of the font. The two low-order bits specify the pitch of the font.
member.returns: Handle to a font object.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.NamedObject
member.summary: Abstract Class representing a named object.
member.remarks: Classes inheriting from this object will have a name associated with it. This is handy when dealing with unique objects within a collection.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.NamedObject._objectName
member.summary: The name of the object.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.NamedObject.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Function to determine if this named object is the same as another named object.
member.returns: TRUE if equal, FALSE if not.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.NamedObject.GetHashCode
member.summary: Function to return the hash code for this object.
member.remarks:
A hash code is used by dictionaries and hash tables to determine uniqueness of an object within those collections.
Hash values are related to their types, and as such should use one or more of its instance fields hash codes to build the hash code.
member.returns: A 32 bit integer representing the hash code.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.NamedObject.ToString
member.summary: Function to return the string representation of this object.
member.returns: A string containing the name of the type and the name stored within the object.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.NamedObject.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.remarks:
Since the Name property is read-only, the name for an object must be passed to this constructor.
Typically it will be difficult to rename an object that resides in a collection with its name as the key, thus making the property writable would be counter-productive.
However, objects that descend from this object may choose to implement their own renaming scheme if they so choose.
Ensure that the name parameter has a non-null string or is not a zero-length string. Failing to do so will raise a SharpException.
member.exception: Thrown when the name parameter is NULL or a zero length string.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node
member.summary: Abstract Class representing a node for an acyclic graph.
member.remarks:
Nodes are used to represent connected points in a graph. This allows us to create a hierarchy of objects, like an upside down tree. A node that has no parent node is considered the root of the node-tree.
Objects deriving from this class will be able to be interconnected with other Node objects.
Node objects can also contain other objects deriving from the INodeObject interface which the derived object can modify those contained objects depending on function of the containing Node.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node._children
member.summary: A list of children for this node.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node._parent
member.summary: The parent of this node, Null (or nothing) if this is the root node.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node._dirty
member.summary: A list of child nodes that need to be updated.

member.name: F:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node._changed
member.summary: A flag to indicate that the node has changed in some way.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.SetParent(SharpUtilities.Collections.Node)
member.summary: Function to set the parent of this node.
member.remarks:
This is the actual implementation for parent reassignment.
See the Parent property for more details.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.MarkDirty(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Function to set nodes to a 'dirty' state.
member.remarks: This function can set the calling Node to a dirty state as well, or it can only just set the children to a dirty state. This can be useful when this node needs to propagate current changes to its children.
member.param: TRUE to only update the children of this node, FALSE to mark this node as well.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.Invalidate
member.summary: Function called when the node is changed in some way.
member.remarks:
Derived classes must implement this function.
This function can be used to update the system in response to the change to the node. For example the objects contained within this node can be updated in response to the change in this node.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.AddChildNode(SharpUtilities.Collections.Node)
member.summary: Function to add a chlid node to this node.
member.remarks:
Call this function in the derived class to add a child node to this node.
When the child node is added, it will be marked as dirty and ready to receive any notifications/changes from the Parent.
member.exception: A child node with the same name already exists.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.Refresh
member.summary: Function to invalidate and update the node.
member.remarks: This function will commit any changes for this node and any nodes in the internal dirty list.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.Clear
member.summary: Function to clear the children from this node.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.GetHashCode
member.summary: Function to return the hash code for this object.
member.remarks:
A hash code is used by dictionaries and hash tables to determine uniqueness of an object within those collections.
Hash values are related to their types, and as such should use one or more of its instance fields hash codes to build the hash code.
member.returns: A 32 bit integer representing the hash code.

member.summary: Constructor.
member.remarks: This will create a new node with the name specified in the parameter.

member.name: P:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.Count
member.summary: Property to return the number of children contained within this node.

member.name: P:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.NodeObjects
member.summary: Read-only property to return a list of node objects.
member.remarks:
The NodeObjects collection is a container of objects that will be associated with this node.
The purpose of having objects contained within the node is to allow changes to the node to be propagated to these objects via the Invalidate() function.
member.value: This will return a NodeObjects collection containing items that are associated with this node.

member.summary: Read-only property to return a child node by its name.
member.value: Returns a Node object representing the child node.
member.exception: The name of the child node was not found.

member.summary: Property to return a child node by its index.

member.exception: The index is not within the range of 0 to Count-1 or the child list is empty.

member.name: P:SharpUtilities.Collections.Node.Parent
member.summary: Property to return or set the parent for this node.
member.remarks:
Use this property if it is necessary to alter the hierarchy relationship of this node.
Null (or Nothing) will be returned if this node is a root node and setting Null will detach this node from its current parent and make ths node a root node.
member.value: Sets or returns a Node object that is the parent of this object.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Collections.NodeObjects
member.summary: A collection of objects that are contained within a node.
member.remarks: A node is an organizational unit, representing a position within a list. A node is also a container for items. For example, a node may contain names and descriptions of people within a company. With this we can organize groups of objects into a tree hierarchy.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Collections.Collection`1
member.summary: Abstract object representing a concrete version of the base collection.
member.remarks:
This collection is inherited from when a standard collection interface is desired. Several methods have been implmented, such as Remove.
This collection inherits from the BaseCollection object and just implements some of the functionality for you.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Collections.BaseCollection`1
member.summary: An abstract class representing a standard collection of objects.
member.remarks:
This was designed as a point of convenience to take some of the annoyance out of inheriting a collection.
This class provides a simplified method of inheriting a basic SortedList collection. It holds no benefit over the System.Collections.Generic.SortedList object, which it uses internally.
This class overloads properties to retrieve or remove an item by its index as well as by its key. These are setup as protected methods so that the user can implement the collection however they see fit.
This class, like the other classes in the Collections namespace, implements the IEnumerable interface already to return an iterator interface for enumeration.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Collections.BaseDictionaryCollection`1
member.summary: An abstract class representing a hash table of objects.
member.remarks:
This was designed as a point of convenience to take some of the annoyance out of inheriting a hash table.
This class provides a simplified method of inheriting a basic list collection. It holds no benefit over the System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary object, which it uses internally.
This class, like the other classes in the Collections namespace, implements the IEnumerable interface already to return an iterator interface for enumeration.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Quaternion
member.summary: A value type representing a quaternion.
member.remarks: A quaternion is a 4 dimensional complex number. It is often used in 3D graphics to represent a rotation. It has an advantage over Euler angles in that it gets around a flaw called Gimbal Lock whereby an axis "locks" and rotation is impossible around that axis (there are better explanations at wikipedia).

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Ray
member.summary: A value type representing a ray.
member.remarks: A ray is straight line extending from a point to an infinite distance. This is represented as the equation: Ax + By + Cz + D = 0. They are often used in 3D mathematics to determine whether intersections exist and where they exist.

member.name: T:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB
member.summary: Object representing an axis aligned bounding box.
member.remarks: An AABB is a boxed bounding volume. This volume is often used to determine occlusion/culling of objects in a 3D scene. Combined with intersection queries it can approximately determine if a point/volume lies within the volume or not.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.UpdateCorners
member.summary: Function to update the corners of the box.
member.remarks:
FROM AXIOM: If the order of these corners is important, they are as follows: The 4 points of the minimum Z face (note that because we use right-handed coordinates, the minimum Z is at the 'back' of the box) starting with the minimum point of all, then anticlockwise around this face (if you are looking onto the face from outside the box). Then the 4 points of the maximum Z face, starting with maximum point of all, then anticlockwise around this face (looking onto the face from outside the box). Like this:
1-----2 /| /| / | / | 5-----4 | | 0-|--3 | / | / |/ |/ 6-----7

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.SetMinimumExtent(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Function to set the minimum extent of the box.
member.remarks: This function is similar to the MinimumExtent property except that it takes explicit coordinates instead of a vector.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.SetMaximumExtent(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Function to set the maximum extent of the box.
member.remarks: This function is similar to the MaximumExtent property except that it takes explicit coordinates instead of a vector.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Scale(System.Single)
member.summary: Function to scale the box by a scalar value.
member.remarks: Use this to shrink or expand the bounding box.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Merge(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB)
member.summary: Function to merge this box with another.
member.remarks:
This function combines two AABBs together and updates the extent of the calling AABB.
The resulting bounding box may be larger than the original, representing the maximum extent between the two boxes.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Update(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Vector3D,SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Vector3D)
member.summary: Function to update the bounding box dimensions.
member.remarks: This function allows for a quick update to the bounding box.
member.param: Minimum extent of the bounding box.
Maximum extent of the bounding box.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Transform(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.Matrix)
member.summary: Function to transform this bounding box by a matrix.
member.remarks:
Use this to translate/rotate a bounding box.
Rotating the box will not change its orientation, but merely its size to fix the extents when the objects orientation changes.

member.summary: Function to test for an intersection between a ray and this AABB.
member.returns: A RayIntersectionQueryResult value containing information about the intersection.

member.summary: Function to test for an intersection between a plane and this AABB.
member.returns: A PlaneIntersectionQueryResult value containing information about the intersection.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Intersects(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection test on this and another AABB.
member.returns: TRUE if there is an intersection, FALSE if not.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Intersects(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.SphereVolume)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection test on this and a bounding sphere.
member.returns: TRUE if there is an intersection, FALSE if not.

member.name: M:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Intersection(SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB)
member.summary: Function to perform an intersection on this and another bounding box.
member.remarks:
Use this to determine area to of intersection between this and another bounding box.
Note: this is NOT the same as an intersection test.
member.returns: A new bounding box representing the two intersected boxes.

member.summary: Read only property to return the center of the bounding box.
member.remarks: This can be used to get an approximate center of an object.
member.value: Returns a Vector3D value containing the center of the bounding box.

member.name: P:SharpUtilities.Mathematics.AABB.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read-only property to return the corners of the box.
member.remarks:
The index should be between 0 and 7 (8 corners) or an exception will be thrown.
The corners are automatically generated when the volume extents change.
member.value: Returns a Vector3D representing the corner of the box.
